---
category: news
title: "Robot mowers could be better for your lawn - and the environment"
excerpt: "Rather than cutting the lawn once every week or two, as most people do, auto-mowers roam constantly, with small spinning blades on the undercarriage trimming grass a few millimeters at a time. These frequent mowings keep grass healthier, says James Murphy, director of the Center for Turf Grass Science at Rutgers University."
